issue.title: accounts.frame.io
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://accounts.frame.io/welcome?auth_callback=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.frame.io%2Fauth%2Fcallback&redirect_path=%2F](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Faccounts.frame.io%2Fwelcome%3Fauth_callback%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapp.frame.io%252Fauth%252Fcallback%26redirect_path%3D%252F) ### Comment > I switched from using Brave brower to Edge today and I was all of the sudden unable to login to www.frame.io. after putting in my credentials, the page just reloads and never logs in. I opened an InPrivate tab and was able to log in just fine. I turned off all extensions and then one by one turned on the extensions and I was able to login fine until enabling Adguard. Once Adguard was enabled the page just reloads at login. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/do4cKxs.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/ZlV9ySI.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser extension v4.1.53 Browser: | EdgeChromium Stealth mode: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

The problem is that extensions for Firefox and Opera cannot download/update Javascript rules.
Please add this rule:
```adblock
facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#%#!function(){var b=0,d=[];new MutationObserver(function(){document.querySelectorAll("div[data-pagelet^=\"FeedUnit\"]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > div:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > span:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div span > h3 ~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"main\"] div[class] > #ssrb_feed_start ~ div > h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]),div[role=\"main\"] div > h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"])").forEach(function(e){Object.keys(e).forEach(function(a){if(a.includes("__reactEvents")||a.includes("__reactProps")){a=e[a];try{if(a.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.feedEdge?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.children?.props?.feedEdge?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")){b++,e.style="display: none !important;";var f=e.querySelector("a[href][aria-label]:not([aria-hidden])");f&&(d.push(["Ad blocked based on property ["+b+"] -> "+f.ariaLabel]),console.table(d))}}catch(a){}}})})}).observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0})}();
```
to user rules.

You can also try to install AdGuard Extra - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra
It also should blocks sponsored posts.
